Method Name : C:\Program Files\Agilent NanoSuite\Methods\XP\G-Series CSM Standard Hardness, Modulus, and Tip Cal.msm
Owner : Agilent AE
Channels
	Modulus
		Internal Name : Modulus
		Units : GPa
		Formula : IF (IsValid(ReducedModulus) , (1.0-pow( PoissonsRatio, 2.0))*pow ( (1/ReducedModulus-(1-pow(TipPoissonsRatio(), 2.0) )/TipModulus()), -1.0), InvalidDouble())
		Description : Subject to a number of assumptions, this is the Young's modulus for the sample. 
Young's modulus relates stress and strain when the material is subjected to 
elastic deformation.  
		Places : 1
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 5
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Contact Area
		Internal Name : ContactArea
		Units : nm^2
		Formula : TipArea(ContactDepth,_TipName)
		Description : The projected contact area between the indenter tip and the sample.
		Places : 0
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 6
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Time
		Internal Name : _Time
		Units : s
		Formula : 
		Description : Time.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 20
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Load On Sample
		Internal Name : LoadOnSample
		Units : mN
		Formula : _Load-_Load[SurfaceMarker] -(_Displacement-_Displacement[SurfaceMarker])*_Column[SurfaceMarker]+ (sqrt(2.0) * _HarmonicLoad)
		Description : Load on the sample, "zeroed" when the indenter first contacts the surface.  
This value has been corrected for the force imposed by the springs supporting 
the indenter shaft.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 1
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Harmonic Stiffness
		Internal Name : _HarmonicStiffness
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 
		Description : Combined harmonic stiffness of the contact together with the frame.
		Places : 0
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 12
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Raw Load
		Internal Name : _Load
		Units : mN
		Formula : 
		Description : Raw force applied electromagnetically to the indenter column.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 16
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Contact Depth
		Internal Name : ContactDepth
		Units : nm
		Formula : if (DisplacementIntoSurface>0.0 AND CurrentIndex() < EndOfLoadingMarker, DisplacementIntoSurface-Epsilon*LoadOnSample/Stiffness,InvalidDouble())
		Description : The depth over which the indenter makes contact with the sample.
		Places : 0
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 7
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Harmonic Contact Stiffness
		Internal Name : Stiffness
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 1/(1/(_HarmonicStiffness)-1/ ( HarmonicFrameStiffnessValue+FrameStiffnessCorrection))
		Description : Harmonic stiffness of the contact, used directly in the calculation of contact area, 
hardness, and reduced modulus.
		Places : 1
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 3
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Stiffness Squared Over Load
		Internal Name : LoadByStiffnessSquared
		Units : GPa
		Formula : if ((DisplacementIntoSurface>0.0) AND (CurrentIndex() < EndOfLoadingMarker), Stiffness*Stiffness/LoadOnSample, InvalidDouble())
		Description : Proportional to the ratio of the square of modulus to hardness.  Useful for
troubleshooting.
		Places : 0
		Notation : Scientific
		Export Order : 18
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Hardness
		Internal Name : Hardness
		Units : GPa
		Formula : if ((DisplacementIntoSurface>0.0) AND (CurrentIndex() < EndOfLoadingMarker), LoadOnSample/ContactArea, InvalidDouble())
		Description : Mean pressure of the contact.
		Places : 2
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 4
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No

	Time On Sample
		Internal Name : TimeOnSample
		Units : s
		Formula : _Time-_Time[SurfaceMarker]
		Description : Time, "zeroed" when the indenter first contacts the surface.  
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 2
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Reduced Modulus
		Internal Name : ReducedModulus
		Units : GPa
		Formula : if ((DisplacementIntoSurface>0.0) AND (CurrentIndex() < EndOfLoadingMarker) AND (CurrentIndex() > SurfaceMarker),Stiffness*Sqrt(Pi())/(2*Beta*sqrt(ContactArea)),InvalidDouble())
		Description : The reduced modulus includes biaxial deformation in both the indenter
and the sample. 
		Places : 1
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 17
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Raw Displacement
		Internal Name : _Displacement
		Units : nm
		Formula : 
		Description : Absolute position of the indenter shaft relative to the center of its full range 
of travel.
		Places : 0
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 15
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Load vs Disp Slope
		Internal Name : _ContactStiffness
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 
		Description : Instantaneous and continuous slope of load with respect to displacement.  
Used for the in-situ determination of surface contact.
		Places : 1
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 13
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	CSM Status
		Internal Name : _CSM
		Units : 
		Formula : 
		Description : Status of lock-in amplifier. A value of 1 indicates everything is OK.
A value of 0 indicates that the analog-to-digital converter is overloaded.
		Places : 0
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 8
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Support Spring Stiffness
		Internal Name : _Column
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 
		Description : Stiffness of the springs which support the indenter column.

		Export Order : 19
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value

	Phase Angle
		Internal Name : _PhaseAngle
		Units : deg
		Formula : 
		Description : Phase angle between the applied load oscillation and the resulting 
displacement oscillation.

	Harmonic Displacement
		Internal Name : _HarmonicDisplacement
		Units : nm
		Formula : 
		Description : Amplitude of displacement oscillation.
		Places : 2
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 9
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Displacement Into Surface
		Internal Name : DisplacementIntoSurface
		Units : nm
		Formula : _Displacement - _Displacement[SurfaceMarker]  -Double(PerformDriftCorrection)* DriftCorrection*(_Time - _Time[SurfaceMarker]) - ((_Load-_Load[SurfaceMarker] )/( FrameStiffnessValue+FrameStiffnessCorrection))+ (sqrt(2.0) * _HarmonicDisplacement)
		Description : Penetration into the test surface as measured from the point at which the 
indenter first touches the sample.  This value has been corrected for thermal
drift and for any deflection in the instrument frame.  
		Places : 0
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 0
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
Inputs
	Internal Use
		Maximum Depth for Average
			Internal Name : MaxCalcDepth
			Default Value : 200  nm
			Description : Only data acquired at surface penetrations less than this value are used in 
the calculation of average hardness and modulus.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : 0
			Maximum : 0
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Minimum Depth for Average
			Internal Name : MinCalcDepth
			Default Value : 100  nm
			Description : Only data acquired at surface penetrations greater than this value are used 
in the calculation of average hardness and modulus.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Surface Displacement
			Internal Name : _SurfaceDisplacement
			Default Value : ****  mm
			Description : Used by several test segments to keep track of the current displacement 
value at the surface of the sample.  Do not delete.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A

			Default Value : 0  nm
			Description : Constant for zero displacement.

			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No

	Data Acquistion Inputs
		BufferSize
			Internal Name : BufferSize
			Default Value : 500  
			Description : Maximum number of points recorded per test segment.  

One this is reached, the data collection task will discard every other
data point.  This number can be set very high or the buffer full
action can be disabled if desired.  See the data collection task.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Data Acquisition Rate
			Internal Name : DataRate
			Default Value : 5  Hz
			Description : Data acquisition rate
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Outer Loop Rate
			Internal Name : _OuterLoopRate
			Default Value : 500  Hz
			Description : Used for data collection.  Do not delete.
			Source : Keyboard Only

			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test

			Only Allow Choice : No

	Oliver & Pharr Constants
		Beta
			Internal Name : Beta
			Default Value : 1.000  
			Description : Factor which allows one to apply the axisymmetric Sneddon contact solution to 
indentation with pyramids.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : 1.000
			Maximum : 1.034
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : Yes
			Only Allow Choice : Yes
			Input Order : N/A
		Epsilon
			Internal Name : Epsilon
			Default Value : 0.750  
			Description : Geometric factor used in the calculation of contact depth.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : 0.720
			Maximum : 0.750
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : Yes
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Frame Stiffness Correction
			Internal Name : FrameStiffnessCorrection
			Default Value : 0  N/m
			Description : Correction applied to the Frame Stiffness.  This correction is added directly
to the Frame Stiffness (i.e. compliances are NOT summed).  Correction might
be needed if the sample is mounted in such a way that affects the 
frame stiffness.

			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Poissons Ratio
			Internal Name : PoissonsRatio
			Default Value : 0.180  
			Description : Poisson ratio for the test sample.  Default value is for fused silica (amorphous
quartz).  Although this value is used in the calculation of modulus, the result is
rather insensitive.  Use the following guidelines: 0.2 for glasses and ceramics; 
0.25 for steels; 0.3 for polymers and soft metals.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : Yes
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : Yes
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
	Reported Test Inputs
		Allowable Drift Rate
			Internal Name : _AllowableDriftRate
			Default Value : 0.05  nm/s
			Description : Thermal stability criteria for initiating tests on a sample.   While the indenter is in 
contact with the test surface under a small constant force, the time rate of
change in the displacement must be less than this value.  The lower the value, the
longer the instrument will wait before initiating testing on a sample. 
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 2
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Depth Limit
			Internal Name : DepthLimit
			Default Value : 2000  nm
			Description : Maximum penetration of the indenter into the test surface.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : Yes
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Frequency Target
			Internal Name : FrequencySetPoint
			Default Value : 45.0  Hz
			Description : Target (set point) for harmonic frequency.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 1
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : Yes
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Harmonic Displacement Target
			Internal Name : HarmonicDisplacement
			Default Value : 2.0  nm
			Description : Target (set point) for amplitude of displacement oscillation.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 1
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : Yes
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Percent To Unload
			Internal Name : PercentToUnload
			Default Value : 90  %
			Description : Percent to reduce the load on the indenter.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Strain Rate Target
			Internal Name : StrainRate
			Default Value : 0.05  1/s
			Description : Loading is controlled such that the loading rate divided by the load on the test 
surface is held constant at this value.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 2
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : Yes
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
	Reported Calculation Inputs
		Percent Unload In Stiffness Calculation
			Internal Name : PercentUnloadInStiffnessCalc
			Default Value : 50  %
			Description : Percent of unloading curve used in the calculation of stiffness from unload.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Perform Drift Correction
			Internal Name : PerformDriftCorrection
			Default Value : 1  
			Description : Flag that determines whether the displacement data are corrected for 
thermal expansion/contraction of the test material and/or equipment. 
 A value of unity means that the correction will be performed.  Note: this
input should be set to zero when testing polymers or metals that creep.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : Yes
			Only Allow Choice : Yes
			Input Order : N/A
	Test Inputs
		Delta X For Finding Surface
			Internal Name : _DeltaXForFindingSurface
			Default Value : -50  um
			Description : Instrument uses a 'practice' indent to locate the test surface.

This is the distance in the x-direction of the practice indent from the first prescribed
indent on the sample.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Delta Y For Finding Surface
			Internal Name : _DeltaYForFindingSurface
			Default Value : -50  um
			Description : Instrument uses a 'practice' indent to locate the test surface.

This is the distance in the y-direction of the practice indent from the first prescribed
indent on the sample.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No

			Only Allow Choice : No

		Peak Hold Time
			Internal Name : PeakHoldTime
			Default Value : 10.0  s
			Description : Time over which load is held constant immediately before each unload.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 1
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Surface Approach Detection Stiffness Criteria
			Internal Name : _SurfaceApproachStiffness
			Default Value : 200  N/m
			Description : 
The support springs of the indenter have a nominal stiffness of 100 N/m.

During the approach test segment, the system monitors the observed stiffness.  
When the observed stiffness is greater than the nominal stiffness by
this amount, the system determines it is on the surface.

			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : Yes
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Surface Approach Distance
			Internal Name : _SurfaceApproachDistance
			Default Value : 1000  nm
			Description : The indenter begins 'looking' for the test surface at this (estimated) distance
above the surface.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : Yes
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Surface Approach Velocity
			Internal Name : _SurfaceApproachVelocity
			Default Value : 10  nm/s
			Description : Speed with which the indenter approaches the test surface.

			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample

Formulas
	Test Formulas
		Drift Correction
			Internal Name : DriftCorrection
			Units : nm/s
			Formula : 
			Description : Displacement rate due to thermal expansion/contraction of the test material.  

			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : Yes
			Reporting Order : 2
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		End Of Loading Marker
			Internal Name : EndOfLoadingMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentIndex()
			Description : Index for the last data point in the loading segment.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : L
			Color : Blue
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		Frame Stiffness Value
			Internal Name : FrameStiffnessValue
			Units : N/m
			Formula : FrameStiffness()
			Description : This value records the frame stiffness at start of the test.

This value should not be recalculated.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Sample
			Notation : Scientific
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No

			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes

			Internal Name : HarmonicFrameStiffnessValue
			Units : N/m
			Formula : FrameStiffness()
			Description : This value records the frame stiffness at start of the test.

This value should not be recalculated.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Sample
			Notation : Scientific
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No

		Max Calc Depth Marker
			Internal Name : MaxCalcDepthMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : ChannelIndex (DisplacementIntoSurface,MaxCalcDepth, SurfaceMarker)
			Description : Index for the last data point to be included in the calculation of average
hardness and modulus.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : N
			Color : Green
			Hidden : No

		Min Calc Depth Marker
			Internal Name : MinCalcDepthMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : ChannelIndex (DisplacementIntoSurface,MinCalcDepth, SurfaceMarker)
			Description : Index for the first data point to be included in the calculation of average
hardness and modulus.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : M
			Color : Green
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		Prescribed Loading Rate
			Internal Name : LoadingRateForStrain
			Units : mN/s
			Formula : LoadOnSample*StrainRate + _SurfaceApproachVelocity * _Column
			Description : Prescribed loading rate based on the prescribed strain rate and current load on the
sample.  Continuously recalculated.  
			Default Value : 
			When : Every Point
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 6
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		Start Hold Marker
			Internal Name : StartHoldMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentIndex()
			Description : Index for the data point corresponding to the start of the hold for thermal drift. 
Used in the calculation of stiffness from unload.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : H
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes

			Internal Name : SurfaceMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : ChannelIndex (_HarmonicStiffness, SurfaceStiffness)
			Description : Index for the data point corresponding to surface contact.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test

			Places : 0

			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentTime()
			Description : Clock reading off the PC at start of test.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No

			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Tip Name
			Internal Name : _TipName
			Units : 
			Formula : TipName()
			Description : References a specific area function.  The area function is an empirical 
polynomial that relates the distance from the apex of the indenter tip to 
cross-sectional area, i.e. A = f(d).  Every real indenter has a unique area function.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : Yes
			Reporting Order : 4
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Unload Limit
			Internal Name : UnloadLimit
			Units : mN
			Formula : LoadOnSample * (1.0-PercentToUnload)
			Description : Load at which to stop the unload.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Unload Rate
			Internal Name : UnloadRate
			Units : mN/s
			Formula : IF (LoadOnSample*StrainRate>UnloadRate, LoadOnSample*StrainRate, UnloadRate)
			Description : Rate at which the indenter is withdrawn from the sample.

			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		Unloading Marker
			Internal Name : UnloadingMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentIndex()
			Description : Index for the data point corresponding to the start of unload.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : U
			Color : Cyan
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
	Oliver & Pharr Calculations
		Avg Hardness [{MinCalcDepth}-{!MaxCalcDepth}]
			Internal Name : AvgHardness
			Units : GPa
			Formula : AverageValue (Hardness,MinCalcDepthMarker,  MaxCalcDepthMarker)
			Description : Average hardness calculated from harmonic data over a specified range of 
penetration depths.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 2
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : Yes
			Reporting Order : 1
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		Avg Modulus [{MinCalcDepth}-{!MaxCalcDepth}]
			Internal Name : AvgModulus
			Units : GPa
			Formula : AverageValue (Modulus,MinCalcDepthMarker,  MaxCalcDepthMarker)
			Description : Average modulus calculated from harmonic data over a specified range of 
penetration depths.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 1
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : Yes
			Reporting Order : 0
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
Configuration Objects
	Indenter Tip
		CurrentTipName

			TipName : B5_2017_02_17
			FunctionType : 0
			Modulus : 1.1635e+005
			Parameters
				Label0 : m0   Value : 2.4725e+001
				Label1 : m1   Value : 4.7739e+002
				Label2 : m2   Value : -3.2229e+003
				Label3 : m3   Value : 3.5580e+003
				Label4 : m4   Value : 0.0000e+000
				Label5 : m5   Value : 0.0000e+000
				Label6 : m6   Value : 0.0000e+000
